column4: HELP!! i just run some kernel updates and lost X! How can I get X back? I had proprietary nvidia drivers installed
What error does X give you?
I got a BSOD and then all I get is text mode
I restarted Ubuntu logo was on but then only text again
Yes I undestand. X cannot start since the drivers (nvidia) don't exist for your current kernel.
I am sick and tired of X failing
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xorg-server I think :)
hi. Can u help me with CLI?
I 'd be happy to :)
If I can of course
Why don't you want to use mkdir?
because the folders are way too many and I want to avoid one step if possible
Oh.. I see :)
Try using the -r switch :)
no luck with recursive
Does it copy all the files and you just want the mp3s?
no I can get the mp3's only. I dont want to create manually the destination folder
try to copy something to a non-existing folder and u ll see what I mean :)
No such file or directory :)
exactly. Cant I use the mkdir somehow inside the cp with quote marks or echo?
I hope we see in ubuntu-gr at freenode
